page.title: 03Henley Local News 28th June
page.content: HEAD FINDS PUPILS GLUE SNIFF CAMPS. A Public Meeting is to be held at GillottÂ£s School to fight this menace. ARABIAN NIGHT ON A VILLAGE GREEN.The Ruler of Oman & owner of Wargrave Manor held a Banquet,Omani style,for the people to mark his reign & generosity. OVER 100 WILL NEVER REACH REGATTA. The Qualifying Races are being held tonight THE TOWN COUNCIL are looking for a site for Bottle Banks,to collect waste glass The Mayor of Henley presented 500 pounds from the proceeds of the Banks to the St.John Ambulance for new ambulances.PROCEEDS FROM THE CHARITY GALA at the Kenton Theatre are going to the Sue Ryder Home for cancer patients. EXTENSIVE PLANTING OF TREES has been carried out in the woodlands at Stonor. GUIDES have collected litter in Henley. SEVERE WINTERÂ£s caused erosion of river bank.WAR MEMORIAL HOSPITAL is for sale.
